<Link id="l00023" /><CodeLine lineNumber="23"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// We must reference the plug-ins in such a way that compilers will not</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00024" /><CodeLine lineNumber="24"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// delete it all as dead code, even with whole program optimization,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00025" /><CodeLine lineNumber="25"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// yet is effectively a NO-OP. As the compiler isn&#39;t smart enough</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00026" /><CodeLine lineNumber="26"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// to know that getenv() never returns -1, this will do the job.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00027" /><CodeLine lineNumber="27"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// This is so that globals in the translation units where these functions</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00028" /><CodeLine lineNumber="28"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// are defined are forced to be initialized, populating various</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00029" /><CodeLine lineNumber="29"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// registries.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00030" /><CodeLine lineNumber="30"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (std::getenv(</span><span class="doxyHighlightStringLiteral">&quot;bar&quot;</span><span class="doxyHighlight">) != (</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">char</span><span class="doxyHighlight">&#42;) -1)</span></CodeLine>
